revision.text:
{{Multiple issues| {{more citations needed|date=December 2008}} {{original research|date=December 2008}} {{primary sources|date=August 2015}} }} '''McDonald's Corporation''' ({{nyse|MCD}}) is the world's largest chain of [[fast food]] restaurants, serving around 68 million customers daily in 119 countries.<ref name=daily>{{cite web|url=https://finance.yahoo.com/news/McDonald-Momentum-Delivers-prnews-2702110553.html?x=0 |title=McDonald's Momentum Delivers Another Year of Strong Results for 2011 |publisher=Yahoo Finance |year=2012 |accessdate=2012-01-25 }}{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.burgerbusiness.com/?p=9168 |title=McDonald’s Answers the Doubters |publisher=BurgerBusiness |date=2012-01-25}}</ref> [[McDonald's]] traces its origins to a 1940 restaurant in [[San Bernardino, California]]. After expanding within the United States, McDonald's became an international corporation in 1967, when it opened a location in [[Richmond, British Columbia|Richmond, Canada]]. By the end of the 1970s, McDonald's restaurants existed in five of the Earth's seven continents; an African location came in 1992 in Cape Town, South Africa.
In order to cater to local tastes and [[Cuisine|culinary traditions]], and often in respect of particular laws or religious beliefs, McDonald's offers regionalized versions of its [[McDonald's products|menu]] among and within different countries. As a result, [[List of McDonald's products|products]] found in one country or region may not be found in McDonald's restaurants in other countries.
==Africa== ===Egypt=== In 2001, McDonald's introduced the [[Falafel|McFalafel]] sandwich in its Egypt locations.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://adage.com/article/news/mcdonald-s-mcfalafel-a-hit-egyptians/15353/|accessdate=2 August 2012|newspaper=Advertising Age|date=19 June 2001|title=McDonald's McFalafel a hit with Egyptians}}</ref> These restaurants also offer a Chicken [[Big Mac]] and Fish Mac, variations on the standard Big Mac which substitute breaded chicken or fish, respectively, for the usual beef patties. In the summer of 2008, McDonald's introduced fish fingers with tartar dipping sauce as a side in Egyptian restaurants. Early 2010 saw the introduction of Egyptian cookies to the [[Cairo]] location. Egypt has almost 70 locations throughout the country.
===Morocco=== The [[McArabia]], a grilled chicken sandwich from [[Morocco]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonaldsarabia.com/oman/en/product_nutrition_details.A%20la%20Carte.12.html|accessdate=1 August 2012|title=McArabia Chicken|publisher=McDonald's}}</ref> In 2005, a product called the McSahara was briefly sold. In late 2006, the Chicken Mythic, ''Petit Plaisirs'' ("small pleasures," a sandwich usually made from chicken or beef), and a 280-gram Recette Moutarde ("mustard burger") were released. During the [[Islam]]ic holy month of [[Ramadan]], a special menu is offered for the breaking of the fast, including local specialties such as dates, milk, and [[harira]].
==Asia== <!---please do not again take out countries for a region called "Middle East". It is NOT a continent and erodes the spatial integrity of both Africa and Asia. Inserting it between the continents is POV and OR.--->
===Bahrain=== As in all McDonald's locations in the Islamic Middle East, food in Bahraini locations is [[halal]].<ref name=halal>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonaldsarabia.com/bahrain/en/the_truth/see_what_we_are_made_of/halal.html|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130128082940/http://www.mcdonaldsarabia.com/bahrain/en/the_truth/see_what_we_are_made_of/halal.html|dead-url=yes|archive-date=28 January 2013|accessdate=3 August 2012|publisher=McDonaldsArabia|title=McDonald's commitment to halal}}</ref> In addition to the McArabia, Bahraini locations offer, beginning in March 2009, the McCrispy, a meal consisting of up to three chicken fingers with a choice of barbecue, sweet and sour, or garlic sauce.
=== China === [[File:McDonald's Chinese New Year set meal.jpg|thumb|150px|McDonald's [[Chinese New Year]] meal, grilled chicken sandwich and twisted French fries. Tray liner has an image of the [[Chinese zodiac]].]] In China, [[Chicken McNuggets]] can come with the traditional barbecue, sweet and sour, honey and hot mustard sauces; or even a special chili garlic sauce, which is popular in China. Chinese menus also include crispy Buffalo chicken wings, called McWings. All chicken burgers offered in Chinese McDonald's use thigh fillet (e.g., Premium Grilled Thigh Fillet Burger, Hot and Spicy Grilled Thigh Fillet Burger), rather than breast meat, which is preferred in [[Western world|western countries]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://articles.nydailynews.com/2012-05-29/news/31890938_1_mcdonalds-hong-kong-china|newspaper=New York Daily News|date=29 May 2012|title=McDonald's in China serves 'Prosperity Burger'|first=Afp|last=Relaxnews}}</ref>
Unique ice cream flavors such as Matcha Green Tea ice cream is available. Pies come in two standard flavors: pineapple or taro, although special flavors including chocolate, apple, banana, and azuki bean have also been offered on a limited basis.
There is a seasonal [[Chinese New Year]] meal available, including the Grilled Chicken Burger and curly fries, with a [[horoscope]] of the twelve zodiac animals of [[Chinese astrology]] and traditional red packets (''[[Red envelope|lai see]]'').
A unique feature of Chinese McDonald's locations is the "McExpress" walk-up window, which sells a small range of drinks and ice cream desserts. Most McExpress windows are attached to restaurants, but in some cases, they can be physically independent, typically in locations such as shopping malls, department stores and subway stations. Most major urban locations offer delivery for an extra fee. Deliveries are usually made by electrically powered scooters, although in several cities where motorcycle bans are in place, a conventional courier bicycle is used. The food is normally carried in a large insulated backpack.
====Hong Kong==== Hong Kong hosts some of the world's busiest McDonald's with many operating 24 hours a day. Breakfasts include pasta soups with sausage or chicken.<ref>{{cite web|author=SirJman |url=http://www.travellingmcds.com/2011/10/twisty-pasta-breakfast-hong-kong.html |title=McDonald's Around the World: Twisty Pasta Breakfast – Hong Kong – Various Dates |publisher=Travellingmcds.com |date=2011-10-27 |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> Locations offer cups of corn as substitutes for French fries or à la carte. Desserts include soft serve ice cream in azuki bean and mung bean flavors; pineapple or red bean sundaes are sometimes offered.
A selection of seasonal or other limited-time foods is available, such as spicy French fries, the Shogun Burger (a [[teriyaki]] pork patty with lettuce served on a sesame seed bun), salads, soups such as tomato and pumpkin,<ref>{{cite web|author=SirJman |url=http://www.travellingmcds.com/2012/02/pumpkin-soup-hong-kong-february-2012.html |title=McDonald's Around the World: Pumpkin Soup – Hong Kong – February 2012 |publisher=Travellingmcds.com |date=2012-02-15 |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> taco flatbreads, the Rice Fantastic (a burger-like entree with rice patties instead of buns). Other such specialties have included shrimp burgers, [[Wasabi]] Filet O' Fish, onion rings,<ref>{{cite web|author=SirJman |url=http://www.travellingmcds.com/2012/04/onion-rings-hong-kong-april-2012.html |title=McDonald's Around the World: Onion Rings – Hong Kong – April 2012 |publisher=Travellingmcds.com |date=2012-04-12 |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> and Shake Shake fries, flavored French fries in flavors such as seaweed, chargrill, French onion, and salt and pepper. During the local [[Cheung Chau Bun Festival|Bun Festival]], restaurants on the island of [[Cheung Chau]] sell mushroom burgers instead of hamburgers and other meat products.
Toys,<ref name="happymeal">{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonalds.com.hk/en/food/meals-and-value-explorer-view/happy-meals-explorer-view.html|title=Happy Meal}}</ref> gift and other non-food promotion products are offered from time to time.
===India=== [[File:McDonald's meal in India.jpg|thumb|McSpicy Chicken, [[McChicken]], Pizza McPuff, [[Chicken McNuggets]] and French fries sold by McDonald's in India.]] Indian McDonald's serve the Chicken Maharaja Mac, a grilled chicken double patty with habanero sauce<ref name="McDonald's Chicken Maharaja Mac - McDonald's India">{{cite web | url=http://www.mcdonaldsindia.net/burgers/chicken-maharaja-mac.aspx | title=McDonald's Chicken Maharaja Mac – McDonald's India | publisher=McDonaldsIndia.net | accessdate=3 August 2016}}</ref> and Veg Maharaja Mac, cheese and corn double patty with cocktail sauce.<ref name="McDonald's Veg Maharaja Mac - McDonald's India">{{cite web | url=http://www.mcdonaldsindia.net/burgers/veg-maharaja-mac.aspx | title=McDonald's Veg Maharaja Mac – McDonald's India | publisher=McDonaldsIndia.net | accessdate=3 August 2016}}</ref> Apart from these, the McSpicy burgers/wraps, McGrill and Pizza McPuff are sold in India.
In 2016, McDonald's released two limited edition burgers called the Mexican and Lebanese McAloo Tikki. The Mexican burger consists of jalapeños, tomatoes and a Mexican marinara sauce; while its Lebanese counterpart is loaded with harissa mayonnaise sauce and gherkins. Both these burgers contain the signature aloo patty with cornmeal dusted buns.<ref name="Mexican McAloo Tikki v/s Lebanese McAloo Tikki">{{cite web | url=https://www.hungryforever.com/mexican-mcaloo-tikki-vs-lebanese-mcaloo-tikki-poll/ | title=Mexican McAloo Tikki v/s Lebanese McAloo Tikki | publisher=Hungry Forever | accessdate=3 August 2016}}</ref>
Past promotional items have included the McPaneer and Grilled Chicken Royale,<ref name="McDonald's launches Royale Range premium burgers - Times of India">{{cite web | url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/business/india-business/McDonalds-launches-Royale-Range-premium-burgers/articleshow/33787842.cms | title=McDonald's launches Royale Range premium burgers – Times of India | publisher=TNN | date=15 April 2014 | accessdate=3 August 2016 | author=Sushma U N}}</ref> Mexican Spice Chicken and Veg, Asian Hot Garlic Dip and African Peri Peri Shake Shake (as part of the Spice Fest)<ref name="Spice route">{{cite web | url=http://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-features/tp-metroplus/spice-route/article3358356.ece | title=Spice route | publisher=The Hindu | date=27 April 2012 | accessdate=3 August 2016}}</ref> Indi-McSpicy and the McCurry Pan.
McDonald's in India do not serve beef products, in deference to [[Hindu]] beliefs. Meat and vegetarian meals are prepared in separate areas of the restaurant due to religious laws; cooks preparing vegetarian dishes wear a distinctive green apron.<ref>{{cite web|author=Mary Vanac |url=http://www.dispatch.com/content/blogs/the-bottom-line/2012/09/mcdonalds-goes-meat-less-in-india.html |title=McDonald's is going meat-less in India |publisher=The Columbus Dispatch |date=2012-09-04 |accessdate=2013-12-14}}</ref>
===Indonesia=== [[File:McDonald's Burger Sate Indonesia 1.jpg|thumb|McDonald's Indonesia promo; Burger Sate, McFlurry Rujak Pedas, Markisa soda tea and Fries. Limited in August only, the month of Indonesian Independence.]] [[File:Congee at McDonald's.jpg|thumb|[[Bubur ayam]] (chicken congee)]] To accommodate [[Muslim]]-majority population, all McDonald's in [[Indonesia]] are certified [[halal]], which means they do not serve bacon or pork patties, while serving only beef, chicken, and fish.<ref>{{cite web | title = Sertifikasi Halal | work = McDonald's Indonesia | url = http://mcdonalds.co.id/menu/kualitas-produk/sertifikasi-halal}}</ref> Local items include crispy and spicy [[fried chicken]]; the McRice, a small mound of [[steamed rice]] wrapped in paper and available to supersize; McSoup, a chicken flavored soup with bits of croutons and vegetables; and ''Buryam'' (short for ''[[bubur ayam]]'' or chicken [[congee]]), later renamed as ''Bubur Ayam Spesial'' with the addition of [[fried egg]] topping.<ref>{{cite web | title = Bubur Ayam Spesial | work = McDonad's Indonesia | url = http://www.mcdonalds.co.id/menu/item/55?ref=19}}</ref> ''[[Sambal]]'' chili sauce, an essential component of [[Indonesian cuisine]], and tomato [[ketchup]] are available as condiments.
McDonald's fried chicken, McRice, and fruit tea are sold together as PaNas (''paket nasi'' or "rice package") with an additional sachet of ''sambal'' chili sauce.<ref>{{cite web | title = PaNas1 | work = McDonald's Indonesia | url = http://www.mcdonalds.co.id/menu/item/64?ref=11}}</ref> This adopts the Indonesians' way of consuming ''[[ayam goreng]]'' (fried chicken) with steamed rice and ''sambal''.
Other than fried chicken with rice and ''bubur ayam'' chicken rice congee, locals' preference of [[rice]]-based food is accommodated further by the introduction of Chicken with Spicy Tomato and Chicken Teriyaki,<ref>{{cite web | title = Chicken with Spicy Tomato & Chicken Teriyaki | work = McDonad's Indonesia | url = http://www.mcdonalds.co.id/promo/75?ref=85}}</ref> which is a bowl of steamed rice topped with strips of fried chicken patty with sauces and vegetables, similar to the Japanese [[donburi]] (rice bowl) fashion of serving.
McDonald's in Indonesia also promotes some seasonal foods, sold only within a limited certain period of time. Those limited periods include Chinese New Year, Ramadhan, and Independence Day specials.
During [[Chinese New Year]], a Beef Prosperity Burger, consisting of two beef patties covered in black pepper sauce and topped with diced onions, is sold.<ref>{{cite web|author=Ta-chan |url=http://jakartalovestory.blogspot.ca/2012/01/mcdonalds-prosperity-burger.html |title=Jakarta Love Story: McDonald's Prosperity Burger |publisher=Jakartalovestory.blogspot.ca |date=2012-01-15 |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref>
During [[Ramadhan]], McDonald's Indonesia has offered BBQ Beef Flatbread (2014), Curry Beef Delight (2015), [[Moroccan cuisine|Moroccan]] Burger (2016) and Ayam Kremes (2017).<ref>{{cite web | title = Ayam Kremes | work = McDonald's Indonesia | url = http://mcdonalds.co.id/promo/175?ref=85}}</ref>
In certain periods, such as August (the month of [[Proclamation of Indonesian Independence|Indonesian independence]]), McDonald's Indonesia launched local-inspired dishes such as the [[Satay|Burger Sate]], a hamburger with [[Peanut sauce|satay sauce]] (spicy ground peanut sauce), with Teh Soda Markisa (passion fruit tea soda);<ref>{{cite web | title = Ini Rasa Kita: Burger Sate | work = McDonald's Indonesia | url = http://www.mcdonalds.co.id/promo/99?ref=85}}</ref> Local-inspired dessert include [[McFlurry]] with ''markisa'' (passion fruit) and ''rujak pedas'' (spicy mango [[rojak|rujak]]) flavour.<ref>{{cite web | title = Ini Rasa Kita: McFlurry Markisa & Rujak Pedas | work = McDonald's Indonesia | url = http://www.mcdonalds.co.id/promo/101?ref=85}}</ref>
===Israel=== [[File:Kosher McDonalds.JPG|thumb|left|[[Kashrut|Kosher]] McDonald's]] {{Main|McDonald's Israel}} The only entirely [[Kashrut|kosher]] McDonald's are in [[Israel]] and [[Argentina]]. In these locations, patties are barbecued on [[charcoal]] rather than [[frying|fried]].<ref name="frommers.com">{{cite web|url=http://www.frommers.com/destinations/buenosaires/D55904.html|title=Kosher McDonald's Restaurant Review | location=Buenos Aires | work=Frommers.com<!-- Bot generated title -->}}</ref> Some kosher locations serve milk based desserts, but in separate booths, allowing for full separation of dairy and meat products in food preparation areas. However, most of the McDonald's outlets in Israel are not kosher service, as they serve cheeseburgers, which mix dairy and meat products.
Specialty items in Israeli McDonald's include the [[Shawarma|McShawarma]] and [[Kebab|McKebab]], both served on flatbread. On January 18, 2011, McDonald's introduced the McFalafel sandwich in Israel, but withdrew the item six months later.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2011/jul/12/mcdonalds-withdraws-mcfalafel-israeli-restaurants | location=London | work=The Guardian | first=Harriet | last=Sherwood | title=McDonald's withdraws McFalafel from Israeli restaurants | date=12 July 2011}}</ref> Within the last few years they have added a vegetarian option, corn sticks (which are bite sized corn shniztels).
===Japan=== [[File:Big Mac hamburger - Japan (2).jpg|thumb|right|A Big Mac as served in Japan]] [[File:Idaho Burger - McDonald's jpn.JPG|thumb|Idaho burgers include bacon, beef, onion, cheese and pepper sauce.]] Regular menu items in Japanese McDonald's include: the Teriyaki McBurger, with ground pork patties, mayonnaise, lettuce, and teriyaki sauce; Shaka Shaka Chicken, a fried chicken strip served in a paper pouch, with cheese or pepper seasonings to shake in the bag; and the Fillet-O-Ebi (shrimp), with a fried shrimp patty and mustard. Breakfast options include a hot dog with pickle relish, ketchup, and mustard,then for lunch and dinner they serve the Chilli McHotdog with egg and chilli sauce. As well as regular soft drinks (which in Japan include grape flavoured Fanta and iced tea), McDonald's in Japan also serve cartons of milk, Minute Maid orange juice and "Yassai Seikatsu", a type of vegetable juice.
Seasonal and limited-time items have included: * The Chicken Katsu Burger, a breaded chicken sandwich flavored with soy sauce and ginger.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.japantoday.com/category/new-products/view/cheese-katsu-burger|newspaper=Japan Today|title=Cheese Katsu Burger|date=30 March 2009}}</ref> * The Gratin [[Korokke]] Burger, a sandwich with korokke (breaded mashed potatoes) filled with shrimp, macaroni, shredded cabbage, and katsu{{clarify|date=May 2012}} sauce, and optional cheese; served during winter *[[File:In Japan, McDonald's (3194818934).jpg|thumb|McDonald counter in Japan]]Green tea-flavored milkshakes * The Salsa Burger, a breaded chicken sandwich with salsa * The Tamago Double Mac, a hamburger with three beef patties, pepper sauce, bacon, a poached egg, and optional cheese * The Teri Tama Burger, a teriyaki burger with egg; served during spring * The [[Tsukimi]] Burger ("moon-viewing burger"), a hamburger with one beef patty, fry sauce, bacon, a poached egg (representing the Moon), and optional cheese; served before and during Tsukimi season * Ume Nuggets, Chicken McNuggets with sour ''ume'' (plum) sauce for dipping * The Mega Teriyaki, a teriyaki-style Big Mac variant with two pork patties and teriyaki sauce * "Quarter Pounder Jewelry" burgers : The 'Gold Ring' available on July 6, 2012, the 'Black Diamond' on July 13, 2013 and 'Ruby Spark' on July 20, 2013 only<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newsonjapan.com/html/newsdesk/article/103439.php|title=McDonald's Japan to offer 1,000-yen premium burgers|work=newsonjapan.com|accessdate=7 October 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303220033/http://newsonjapan.com/html/newsdesk/article/103439.php|archive-date=3 March 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2013/07/03/business/mcdonalds-to-offer-1000-burgers|title=McDonald's to offer ¥1,000 burgers – The Japan Times|work=The Japan Times|accessdate=7 October 2015}}</ref>
On United States military establishments in Japan (like the US Naval Base in Yokosuka), both American and Japanese menus are sold, depending on availability.
Japan has made "American burgers". The burgers in Japan are based on imaginations and symbolisms of burgers from different regions of the U.S. Such as Idaho burgers.
===Malaysia=== All McDonald's in [[Malaysia]] are certified halal.<ref>{{cite web|author=Patrick Lee |url=http://www.thestar.com.my/News/Nation/2013/09/13/Our-food-is-halal-says-McDonalds.aspx |title=Our food says Halal, says McDonald's |publisher=The Star Online |date=2013-09-13 |accessdate=2013-12-14}}</ref> Regular menu items include the Spicy Chicken McDeluxe, a burger with crispy marinated chicken, lettuce, and special sauce in a cornmeal bun, the Bubur Ayam McD ("McD Chicken Porridge"), chicken strips in rice porridge with scallions, sliced ginger, fried shallots, and diced chilies,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://sixthseal.com/2005/04/mcd-chicken-porridge-bubur-ayam-mcd/|title=McD Chicken Porridge (Bubur Ayam McD)|work=sixthseal.com|accessdate=8 October 2015}}</ref> and the Ayam Goreng McD ("McD's Fried Chicken"), large chicken strips made just like the ones sold at [[KFC]] restaurants served in two-piece or three-piece meals. The Ayam Goreng McD was introduced as McDonald's Fried Chicken in 1986. The product's name was changed to Chicken McCrispy in 2000 and again to Ayam Goreng McD in 2002 to better suit the country's culture.
Other seasonal and limited-time specialties have included the Bubur Ikan McD (a fish variant of the Bubur Ayam McD), the Grilled Chicken Foldover (equivalent to the McArabia), the Grilled Chicken Burger and spicy McNuggets.<ref name="gozonews.com">{{cite web|url=http://gozonews.com/645/mcdonald%E2%80%99s-new-mccafe-in-victoria/|title=Gozo News.Com|work=Gozo News.Com|accessdate=8 October 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304035919/http://gozonews.com/645/mcdonald%E2%80%99s-new-mccafe-in-victoria/|archive-date=2016-03-04|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref> Specialty desserts have included a kiwifruit sundae, served in 2000 in [[Kuala Lumpur]].
Like in Singapore and Indonesia, during Chinese New Year, Prosperity Burgers are sold. These come in beef and chicken varieties. In 2011, these were served with a McFizz, a specialty beverage mixing [[Minute Maid]] orange juice and [[Sprite (soft drink)|Sprite]], and Curly Fries.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mcdonalds.com.my/highlights/prosperity_burger.asp |title=i'm lovin' it! McDonald's® Malaysia |publisher=Mcdonalds.com.my |date=2008-04-15 |accessdate=2012-08-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120810012249/http://www.mcdonalds.com.my/highlights/prosperity_burger.asp |archivedate=2012-08-10 |df= }}</ref>
Another limited time promotional item that appears almost yearly is the Samurai Burger, a large beef burger dipped in teriyaki sauce. In 2012 it was promoted with two new sides, a Sakura McFizz (Sprite + [[Ribena]]), and the Katsu Curry McShakers.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.travellingmcds.com/2012/10/samurai-burger-sakura-mcfizz-katsu.html|title=McDonald's Around the World: Samurai Burger, Sakura McFizz & Katsu Curry McShaker – Johor Bahru, Malaysia – September 2012|work=travellingmcds.com|accessdate=8 October 2015}}</ref> They also serve a unique 'Taro Pie, a pie made of [[taro]].
===Pakistan=== All McDonald's in Pakistan are certified halal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonalds.com.pk/faqs |title=McDonald's » Faqs |publisher=Mcdonalds.com.pk |date= |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> Pakistani menus resemble those of Middle Eastern and South Asian locations. McArabias and Spicy Chicken Burgers are popular in Pakistan.{{citation needed|date=May 2012}} A Chicken Big Mac is also available. In addition to apple pie, McDonald's Pakistan serves choco-orange pie and blueberry custard pie, which is fried. All McDonald's Pakistan menu items with the exception of ice cream cones are also available for delivery.
===Philippines=== Most Filipinos colloquially refer to McDonald's as "McDo" (equivalent to "Mickey D's"), and the term has been adapted by McDonald's Philippines, even naming most of their products after the term. Menu items in McDonald's in the [[Philippines]] include McSpaghetti, Chicken McDo, Burger McDo and Crispy Chicken Sandwich, in order to compete with the country's largest fast food retail [[Jollibee]]. From 2001 to 2006 the McRice, steamed rice formed into buns, was available as a replacement for bread buns on beef and chicken sandwiches.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.philstar.com/Article.aspx?articleId=365232&publicationSubCategoryId=81 |title=A handy rice meal – The Philippine Star » Lifestyle Features » Food and Leisure |publisher=Philstar.com |date=2006-10-26 |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> Breakfast menus include [[longaniza]], a [[Philippine cuisine|Philippine]] sausage, served with rice and a fried egg, and the Hamdesal, a [[Pandesal]] bun with pineapple glaze syrup, mayonnaise, and Canadian bacon served with scrambled eggs, cheese, or both.
Some pies come in pineapple and [[taro]] flavors, although the McDonald's Apple Pie is served in all locations. Only select locations serve milkshakes. Twister Fries is also served seasonally, as well as Shake Shake Fries, which are McDonald's French Fries that come in a paper bag and served with a packet of flavored powder (Barbeque, Cheesy Butter, Sour Cream, Ketchup, and Pizza flavors); customers must administer the flavoring to the bag of fries themselves, shaking the bag until the powder is evenly distributed among the fries. They are available annually.
McDonald's in the Philippines also promotes movie tie-in products seasonally, such as the Banana-Oreo McFlurry and Banana McFloat during the release of the Minions movie in 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.inquisitr.com/294827/mcdonalds-curly-fries-they-exist-but-probably-not-in-your-neighborhood/ |title=McDonald’s Curly Fries… They Exist, But Probably Not In Your Neighborhood |publisher=Inquisitr.com |date=2012-08-07 |accessdate=2014-04-08}}</ref>
===Saudi Arabia=== All McDonald's in [[Saudi Arabia]] are certified halal.<ref name=halal/> Saudi locations serve the Spicy McChicken, McArabia, and the Big Tasty, the latter of which is also available in some European locations.
===Singapore=== All McDonald's in Singapore are certified halal.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mcdonalds.com.sg/eatsmart_faq.html |title=Welcome | McDonald's Singapore |publisher=Mcdonalds.com.sg |date= |accessdate=2012-08-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130418104608/http://www.mcdonalds.com.sg/eatsmart_faq.html |archivedate=2013-04-18 |df= }}</ref> Singaporean locations offer the McSpicy, a spicy chicken burger.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonalds.com.sg/eatsmart_menu_mcspicy.html |title=Welcome | McDonald's Singapore |publisher=Mcdonalds.com.sg |date= |accessdate=2012-08-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120927085810/http://www.mcdonalds.com.sg/eatsmart_menu_mcspicy.html |archivedate=2012-09-27 |df= }}</ref> A 24-hour McDelivery service is available in all locations on [[Pulau Ujong|the island]].
The curry sauce is a dip unique to Singapore and is the favourite complementary dip to Chicken McNuggets.
In 2011, due to congestion at the United States' West Coast ports, the popular chicken nugget dip was unavailable for a period of time,<ref>{{cite news|last1=Yeo|first1=Miranda|title=McDonald's curry sauce returns today|url=http://news.asiaone.com/news/soshiok/mcdonalds-curry-sauce-returns-today|accessdate=3 August 2016|publisher=asiaone|date=18 June 2015}}</ref> causing a public outcry. A similar crisis happened in 2015.
In July 2016, McDonald's launched a limited edition take-home bottle of the curry sauce (375ml) and is limited to four purchases per single receipt.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.todayonline.com/lifestyle/mcdonalds-curry-sauce-available-limited-edition-take-home-bottle-july-21|title=McDonald’s Curry Sauce available in limited edition take-home bottle from July 21|publisher=TODAY|date=15 July 2016}}</ref> The news was met with overwhelming popularity and several outlets ran out of stock on the item extremely quickly.
McDonald's has also introduced several special additions to the Singapore menu, such as the Salted Egg York Chicken Burger in 2016, coupled with salt & pepper shaker fries and Gula Melaka McFlurry.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/singapore/mcdonald-s-singapore/2915700.html|title=McDonald's Singapore launches menu inspired by local flavours|publisher=ChannelNewsAsia|date=29 June 2016}}</ref>
===South Korea=== [[File:Bulgogi burger.jpg|thumb|McDonald's Bulgogi burger in South Korea]] McDonald's locations in South Korea serve a shrimp burger as well as a Bulgogi Burger, a pork patty in [[bulgogi]] marinade. The bulgogi-flavored sauce was developed by [[Ottogi]], a large South Korean food manufacturer that provides all of the condiments to the country's McDonald's.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joinsmsn.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2902414 |title=Can tteokbokki rescue rice industry? |date=2009-03-19 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120405232757/http://koreajoongangdaily.joinsmsn.com/news/article/article.aspx?aid=2902414 |archivedate=2012-04-05 |df= }}</ref> A 24-hour [[McDelivery]] service was launched in 2007 and now is available across South Korea.<ref>{{cite web|title = 16 McDonald’s Vehicles We Doubt You’ve Ever Seen|url = http://www.lifedaily.com/story/16-mcdonalds-vehicles-we-doubt-youve-ever-seen/10/|website = lifedaily|accessdate = 15 February 2017|archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20170216054413/http://www.lifedaily.com/story/16-mcdonalds-vehicles-we-doubt-youve-ever-seen/10/|archive-date = 2017-02-16|dead-url = yes|df = }}</ref> McDelivery also has an app available on both Google Play and the Apple Store.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.mwos2.mcdelivery |title=(공식) 맥도날드 맥딜리버리 배달|publisher=Google Play |accessdate=15 February 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/mcdelivery-korea/id1027699629 |title=McDelivery Korea|publisher=Apple Store |accessdate=15 February 2017}}</ref>
Dessert options include [[affogato]]. Former options included a green tea [[McFlurry]]<ref>{{cite web|author=SirJman |url=http://www.travellingmcds.com/2011/12/green-tea-mcflurry-seoul-korea-january.html |title=McDonald's Around the World: Green Tea McFlurry – Seoul, South Korea – January 2009 |publisher=Travellingmcds.com |date=2011-12-07 |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> and the McBingsu, a seasonal option similar to [[patbingsu]].
===Taiwan=== McDonald's in Taiwan serve ''kao fan'' (烤飯, ''kǎo fàn'') (literally "baked rice"), a burger-like entrée with rice patties instead of buns.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/femail/food/article-1126655/The-hotlist-10-unusual-items-McDonalds-menus-world.html | location=London | work=Daily Mail | title=The hotlist: 10 unusual items on McDonald's menus around the world}}</ref> It is modelled on the eponymous product of McDonald's Japanese rival, [[MOS Burger]]. McDonald's locations in Taiwan sell fried chicken legs to compete with [[KFC]]. Additionally, [[corn soup]] is available as a substitute for French fries or à la carte.
===Thailand=== [[File:McDonalds Meal.JPG|thumb|right|[[McChicken]], Filet-O-Fish, Chicken McNuggets, French fries and fried chicken sold by McDonald's in [[Bangkok]].]]
In [[Thailand]], McDonald's serves the [[Samurai]] Pork Burger, with teriyaki sauce, lettuce, and mayonnaise.<ref>{{cite web|author=JetSetCD |url=http://www.jaunted.com/story/2011/10/17/221250/07/travel/Munching+McDonald%27s+Exotic+%27Samurai+Pork+Burger%27+in+Phuket |title=Munching McDonald's Exotic 'Samurai Pork Burger' in Phuket |publisher=Jaunted |date= |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> As in other Asian markets, Thai McDonald's sell fried chicken and spicy chicken wings. Chilli sauce is available as a condiment, along with [[ketchup]]. Other Thailand-specific items include rice patties made with [[jasmine rice]], the [[Caribbean cuisine|Caribbean]] Shrimp Burger, and a salad shaker based on ''som tam'' [[Carica papaya|papaya]] salad. McDonald's restaurants in Thailand also serve the Mega animals Mac (known as the Double Big Mac) all year long.
Between October 1 and 13, 2013, or until supplies ran out, McDonald's offered a "McVeggie" burger to coincide with the tradition of many people of Chinese descent only eating vegetarian food during the annual "[[Nine Emperor Gods Festival|Kin J]]" period. The McVeggie is an all vegetable fried patty consisting of potatoes, beets, peas and carrot topped with lettuce and teriyaki sauce.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/photo.php?fbid=10151874944932866&set=a.100032547865.89349.100023357865&type=1&theater|title=McDonald's – New Promotion October 2013 – Facebook|work=facebook.com|accessdate=8 October 2015}}</ref>
===Turkey=== All McDonald's meat in [[Turkey]] are certified [[halal]] by Pinar, a Turkish company. Restaurants offer the Turkish drink [[ayran]] and the McTurco, a type of [[kebab]] with chicken or beef.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.travellingmcds.com/2012/09/mcturko-istanbul-turkey-august-2012.html|title=McDonald's Around the World: McTurko – Istanbul, Turkey – August 2012|work=travellingmcds.com|accessdate=8 October 2015}}</ref> Turkish locations also serve onion rings, the Mega Mac (known as the Double Big Mac) and the Kofteburger, with a spiced mincemeat patty.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.brandeating.com/2010/04/whats-on-menu-mcdonalds-turkey.html |title=What's on Menu: McDonald's Turkey |publisher=Brand Eating |date=2010-04-18 |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref>
===United Arab Emirates=== In the United Arab Emirates, as of 2016, McDonald's standard ''a-la-carte'' menu include the hamburger (marketed as "beefburger"), cheeseburger, double cheeseburger, chicken burger, veggie burger, [[Quarter Pounder|Quarter Pounder with Cheese]], [[Big Mac]], Mega Mac, [[Big N' Tasty|Big Tasty]], McRoyale, [[McChicken]], Spicy McChicken, Chicken Mac, Chicken Mega Mac, [[Grand Chicken]] (Classic, Deluxe, Special, and Spicy variants), [[McArabia|McArabia Chicken]], [[Chicken McNuggets]], and [[Filet-O-Fish]] sandwiches. In some outlets, the Indian-inspired Mc [[Aloo tikki|Aloo Tikki]] burger is also served as part of the McSavers and [[Happy Meal]] lines.
The McArabia initially was available as both a chicken and beef [[kofta]] variants, but only the chicken remained as standard, although the kofta and [[sujuk]] variants are sometimes reintroduced in limited promotional runs. Other limited edition sandwiches included The Asian, The Mexican, The French, and The Turkish. The standard menu formerly carried other McDonald's staples such as the Chicken Fillet, the Spicy Chicken Fillet, and the McWings.
McDonald's in the U.A.E. is a certified halal chain.<ref name=halal/>
===Vietnam=== Vietnam serves broken rice also known as Cơm tấm, named simply as cơm. The dish consists of [[broken rice]], grilled pork and various other sides that come at an extra price. Bánh mì(General term for bread) is also served and looks very similar to a [[Subway sandwich]].
==Europe== ===Belgium=== Belgian McDonald's serve the Croque McDo, consisting of two slices of [[Emmental (cheese)|Emmental cheese]] and a slice of ham toasted between two hamburger buns. This is a variation of the traditional [[croque-monsieur]] sandwich found in France and Belgium.<ref name=nile>{{cite web|url=http://www.nileguide.com/blog/2010/06/09/strange-mcdonalds-menu-items-around-the-world/|accessdate=3 August 2012|publisher=NileGuide|title=Strange McDonald's Menu Items around the world|author=Resnik, Alex|date=9 June 2010}}</ref> The "Belgo" burger is a hamburger with bacon, Belgian [[Maredsous Abbey#Maredsous cheese|Maredsous cheese]], roasted onions, and [[cocktail sauce]].
===Croatia=== The McCountry sandwich is a regular menu item in Croatian McDonald's restaurants, consisting of two pork sausage patties on a bun with cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, and a special sauce. Another regular menu item is the McToast, a ham and cheese sandwich on toast. The Maestro Burger can also be found which is normally seen in the Netherlands. Seasonal and promotional offers include [[Greek cuisine|Greek]] and Italian offerings.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mcdonalds.hr/ponuda/mccountry/ |title=Mcdonalds |publisher=Mcdonalds |date= |accessdate=2015-09-02}}</ref>
===Cyprus=== McDonald's in [[Cyprus]] sells the Greek Mac, a Big Mac variant with pita bread and [[tzatziki]] sauce, and the Greek Chicken, a Greek Mac with chicken patties instead of beef.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mcdonalds.com.cy/Menu.html |title=Mcdonalds |publisher=Mcdonalds |date= |accessdate=2012-08-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120427042501/http://www.mcdonalds.com.cy/Menu.html |archivedate=2012-04-27 |df= }}</ref> A shrimp burger is also sold during the period of [[Great Lent|Lent]] when [[Church of Cyprus|Orthodox Christians]] don't eat meat. This only applies to the Republic of Cyprus, and not the northern [[Northern Cyprus|Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus]], where due to the lack of international recognition, McDonald's does not exist.
===Czech Republic=== The McCountry sandwich served in Croatia is also available in the [[Czech Republic]].
In 2012, McDonald's added McSmažák, a variation on [[smažený sýr]], a type of [[cheese sandwich]].<ref>{{cite web|author=LetsEat |url=http://letseatcyprus.blogspot.ca/ |title=LetsEat.Com.Cy |publisher=Letseatcyprus.blogspot.ca |date=2012-06-05 |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> It is similar to the Slovak McSyr.
===Denmark=== In [[Denmark]], every McDonald's serves a small size chicken burger called "Chicken Salsa Cheese". As similar to Finland and Sweden's "El Maco", Danish McDonald's locations sells "El Maco Jr.": A small size "El Maco".<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.travellingmcds.com/2012/09/el-maco-jr-copenhagen-denmark-august.html|title=McDonald's Around the World: El Maco Jr – Copenhagen, Denmark – August 2012|work=travellingmcds.com|accessdate=8 October 2015}}</ref> Also following its other Scandinavian cousins, Danish McDonald's serve a Daim McFlurry.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.travellingmcds.com/2012/09/daim-mcflurry-copenhagen-denmark-august.html|title=McDonald's Around the World: Daim McFlurry – Copenhagen, Denmark – August 2012|work=travellingmcds.com|accessdate=8 October 2015}}</ref>
===Finland=== In [[Finland]], most McDonald's hamburgers can be ordered with a [[Rye bread|rye]] bun, based on the success of the promotional "McRuis" (McRye) burger.<ref>{{cite web|author=Published: May 17, 1999 |url=http://adage.com/article/news/mcdonald-s-patent-rye-bread-burger/13813/ |title=McDonald's tries to patent rye bread burger | News – Advertising Age |publisher=Adage.com |date=1999-05-17 |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> ''El Maco'' is a burger with salsa and [[sour cream]] sauce. The El Maco meal is served with a barbecue spice mixture and a paper bag in which the fries and the spice mixture are poured, similar to Japan's Shaka Shaka Chicken. In 2018 McDonald's released the [[Big Mac]] with bacon. Also same as in Sweden, they are offering McVegan patty for vegans in wraps, sallad or as a burger. [[Macarons]] are also served as a [[McCafe]] product. In early 2018 they released [[Valio]] [[Oltermanni]] Juustonapit that is basically small cheese nuggets filled with the famous Finnish cheese.
===France=== In France, McDonald's offers donuts for breakfast and [[Kronenbourg Brewery|Kronenbourg 1664]] beer in 25 or 33 cl measures. The Croque McDo and various ''Petit Plaisir'' items are available, as in Belgium and Morocco, respectively.<ref name=nile/> In 2016, McDonald's launched a summer menu, called the "American Summer" Menu, with one burger containing crispy peppers.
===Germany=== Standard menu items at German McDonald's include the Hamburger Royal TS, [[Caesar salad]]s, one Veggieburger called Veggie Clubhouse,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonalds.de/produkte/alle-produkte|title=McDonald's – Alle Produkte|publisher=mcdonalds.de|accessdate=12 August 2016|language=de}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonalds.de/produkte/produkt-profil?productName=veggie_clubhouse|title=McDonald's veggie clubhouse at the German McDonald's homepage |publisher=Mcdonalds.de |date= |accessdate=2016-02-08}}</ref> and Caesar, [[honey mustard]], and [[Ranch dressing|Ranch]] chicken wraps.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonalds.de/produkte/alle-produkte |title=Permanent German Menu |publisher=Mcdonalds.de |date= |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> The [[McRib]] sandwich, a seasonal item in most countries, is a permanent menu item in Germany.<ref>{{cite news |last=Feder |first=Barnaby J. |title=A McDonald's Burger of the Garden Variety |date=December 9, 1992 |newspaper=The New York Times |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1992/12/09/business/a-mcdonald-s-burger-of-the-garden-variety.html?pagewanted=all&src=pm |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/63E6AFigr?url=http://www.nytimes.com/1992/12/09/business/a-mcdonald-s-burger-of-the-garden-variety.html?pagewanted=all&src=pm |archivedate=November 16, 2011 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=McRib product information at mcdonalds.de |url=http://www.mcdonalds.de/produkte/produkt-profil?productName=mcrib|accessdate=24 October 2011}}</ref>
As of Mid-February 2013, McDonald's Germany started selling the Mc[[Currywurst]] with [[bread roll]] or Fries, a hot sausage with tangy tomato sauce and [[Curry]] powder in mild and spicy.<ref>{{cite web|title=McCurrywurst product information at mcdonalds.de |url=http://www.mcdonalds.de/produkte/produkt-profil?productName=mccurrywurst|accessdate=17 February 2013}}</ref> The item is no longer sold (September 2016).
The German McDonald's Breakfast does provide Brötchen, a crispy bread roll; McCroissant, a [[Croissant]] stuffed with [[Ham]] and Cheese; [[Scrambled Eggs]] with [[Bacon]] and "Classic Breakfast", a choice of bread rolls with sweet spreads resembling a very common German breakfast choice.<ref>{{cite web|title=Breakfast product information at mcdonalds.de |url=http://www.mcdonalds.de/produkte/fruehstueck|accessdate=17 February 2013}}</ref>
Beer is no longer sold at all locations. It is still served in older outlets owned by German brewers with leases allowing the serving of beer.<ref>"Behind the Arches" by John Love, page 433-434</ref>
===Greece=== McDonald's in [[Greece]] currently sells the Greek Mac, a Big Mac variant on [[pita]] bread with [[tzatziki]] sauce.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://surveyforcustomers.com/www-mcdvoice-com/ |title=Mcdonalds McDVoice Survey |publisher=Mcdonalds |date= |accessdate=2018-09-07 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150712203102/http://mcdonalds.gr/en/products/ta-burger-mas/greek-mac |archivedate=2015-07-12 |df= }}</ref> Other regular menus include the McToast,<ref name="Mcdonalds">{{cite web |url=http://mcdonalds.gr/el/products/finger-food/veggie-snackers |title=Mcdonalds |publisher=Mcdonalds |date= |accessdate=2016-04-24 }}{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> a ham and cheese sandwich on toast, Deluxe fries<ref name="Mcdonalds"/> ([[potato wedges]]), and [[onion rings]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://mcdonalds.gr/en/products/finger-food/onion-rings |title=Mcdonalds |publisher=Mcdonalds |date= |accessdate=2016-04-24 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160507001122/http://mcdonalds.gr/en/products/finger-food/onion-rings |archivedate=2016-05-07 |df= }}</ref> [[Heineken]] beer is also served in all locations.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://mcdonalds.gr/en/products/cold-drinks/beer |title=Mcdonalds |publisher=Mcdonalds |date= |accessdate=2016-04-24 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160507002130/http://mcdonalds.gr/en/products/cold-drinks/beer |archivedate=2016-05-07 |df= }}</ref>
During the period of [[Great Lent|Lent]] when [[Church of Greece|Orthodox Christians]] abstain from eating meat, McDonald's also offers the McVeggie burger,<ref name="Mcdonalds"/> a Shrimp Burger,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://mcdonalds.gr/el/products/ta-burger-mas/shrimp-burger |title=Mcdonalds |publisher=Mcdonalds |date= |accessdate=2016-04-24 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160409172659/http://mcdonalds.gr/el/products/ta-burger-mas/shrimp-burger |archivedate=2016-04-09 |df= }}</ref> a McWrap Shrimp,<ref>{{cite web |url=http://mcdonalds.gr/el/products/wraps/mcwrap-shrimp |title=Mcdonalds |publisher=Mcdonalds |date= |accessdate=2016-04-24 }}{{dead link|date=January 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> fried veggie snackers,<ref name="Mcdonalds"/> [[spring rolls]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://mcdonalds.gr/el/products/finger-food/spring-rolls |title=Mcdonalds |publisher=Mcdonalds |date= |accessdate=2016-04-24 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170417012147/http://mcdonalds.gr/el/products/finger-food/spring-rolls |archivedate=2017-04-17 |df= }}</ref> and fried shrimp with dipping sauce.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://mcdonalds.gr/el/products/finger-food/garides |title=Mcdonalds |publisher=Mcdonalds |date= |accessdate=2016-04-24 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170424085233/http://mcdonalds.gr/el/products/finger-food/garides |archivedate=2017-04-24 |df= }}</ref>
===Hungary=== Hungarian McDonald's sell the McFarm, once available in Greece. Limited-time products available only in Hungary have included McDonald's version of the popular Hungarian breakfast food [[lángos]], and a "Hungarian flavors" menu.<ref>{{cite web |author=— 08/10/31 |url=http://www.chew.hu/all_hell_breaks_loose_as_mcdon/ |title=All Hell Breaks Loose as McDonalds Hungary Goes "McMagyar" |publisher=Chew.hu |date= |accessdate=2012-08-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130115013952/http://www.chew.hu/all_hell_breaks_loose_as_mcdon/ |archivedate=2013-01-15 |df= }}</ref>
===Italy=== Italian McDonald's offers, since 2000, Crispy McBacon, composed of two beef patties, one slice of cheddar, bacon and a special sauce. In 2014 a variation with chicken is offered. It also began offering "McItaly" items since 2010 in a limited period. Products include burger with "100 percent made-in-Italy meat" and various typical Italian ingredients. The company advertises burgers in several European countries as using Italian beef, because Cremonini provides it in various locations.<ref name="marchetti20100529">{{cite news | url=http://www.post-gazette.com/stories/business/news/mcitaly-menu-merges-buy-local-with-fast-food-248805/?print=1 | title=McItaly menu merges 'buy local' with fast food | work=Pittsburgh Post-Gazette | date=2010-05-29 | agency=GlobalPost | accessdate=May 31, 2012 | author=Marchetti, Silvia}}</ref> On May 24, 2013 McDonald's Italia in cooperation with [[Barilla Group|Barilla]] began offering for a limited period a [[pasta salad]]<ref name=Guardian52313>{{cite news|title=McDonald's joins forces with 136-year-old pasta firm in Italy Fast-food chain will sell pasta salad from Friday in attempt to Italianise menu after deal with Parma-based Barilla|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2013/may/23/mcdonalds-joins-forces-pasta-italy-barilla|accessdate=May 24, 2013|newspaper=The Guardian|date=May 23, 2013|author=Lizzy Davies|quote=pennette pasta with "a balanced and skilful mix of tuna, tomatoes, peppers, capers and olives, seasoned with a pinch of oregano and salt"}}</ref> McCafè, launched in 2005, has also been adapted to Italian taste. From May 2015 the menu includes the vegetarian burger McVeggie, offered here with no cheese.
A [[Nutella]] burger debuted in 2016.<ref>{{cite web|author=Sternitzky-Di Napoli, Daniela|url=http://www.chron.com/life/food/article/McDonald-s-introduces-new-a-burger-Nutella-10610517.php|title=http://www.chron.com/life/food/article/McDonald-s-introduces-new-a-burger-Nutella-10610517.php|publisher=''[[Houston Chronicle]]''|date=2016-11-12|accessdate=2018-11-05}}</ref>
===Malta=== In [[Malta]], McDonald's sell mozzarella sticks and chicken wings as side dishes. The Big Tasty is a variant to the Big N' Tasty while chicken nuggets come with an array of sauces, such as BBQ, sweet and sour, ketchup or mayonnaise. The McCafe was also first introduced in Malta, more specifically on its sister island Gozo, where the only McDonald's and McCafe on the island are found in the Arcadia shopping centre in the capital city of Victoria.<ref name="gozonews.com"/> It is also the place where the McFtira was sold, a beef or chicken burger with the addition of goat cheese and served in traditional Maltese bread.
===Netherlands=== In the [[Netherlands]], McDonald's sells the McKroket, a deep-fried roll containing beef [[ragout]], similar to the Dutch bitterballen sold in snack bars.<ref>{{cite news | url=http://money.cnn.com/galleries/2008/fortune/0805/gallery.royale.fortune/3.html | work=CNN | title=Beyond 'Royale with Cheese' | date=8 May 2008 | access-date=2012-08-03 | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121012034813/http://money.cnn.com/galleries/2008/fortune/0805/gallery.royale.fortune/3.html | archive-date=2012-10-12 | dead-url=yes | df= }}</ref> Dutch McDonald's serve frite sauce or "American Sauce," a yellow mayonnaise-like sauce not eaten in the United States with French fries. The ChickenSaté burger was also offered, consisting of fried chicken with peanut sauce; this popular food is inspired by the Netherlands' historical connection to Indonesia. The Joppie Burger was also available using Joppie sauce, popular in the Netherlands. Since 2015, the Maestro Burger menu has been available. The Maestro Burger is a large burger with sesameseed bread, 2 Angus beef patties, onion, lettuce, bacon and mustard. The Chicken Maestro Burger, and the Maestro Burger Egg, a version of the regular burger with an added egg, have been made available since the original burger's launch. Also included in the menu is "Boerenfriet", which are thick, large fries, as commonly found in burgerbars, as well as regular mayonnaise. The introduction of the Maestro Burger is part of the revamp McDonald's is going through in the Netherlands since change of directors, focussing more on customers that seek higher quality burgers and that who would usually visit burgerbars. Special Dutch drinks include Fristi (a yogurt drink) and Chocomel (a chocolate milk drink). Also available in the Netherlands are ''[[stroopwafel]]'' McFlurries.
===Norway=== As in Finland, Norwegian McDonald's serve the El Maco (on a seasonal basis) and offer gluten free buns without an extra cost. They also serve a Laksewrap, deep-fried fish with salad and a mango slice in a tortilla.<ref name=nile/>
In 2002, the [[McAfrika]] burger was introduced in [[Norway]], coinciding with major famines in Southern Africa. The name of the burger drew much negative publicity as being highly insensitive.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.delish.com/food-fun/mcdonalds-mcafrika-fast-food-flops#slide-8 | title=We're Not Lovin' It! Fast Food's Most Famous Flops | accessdate=2013-06-07 | author=Borja, Sahara}}</ref> The burger with vegetables were placed in pita bread.<ref>*{{cite web|last=McGrath|first=Jane|title=5 Failed McDonald's Menu Items: McAfrica |url=http://money.howstuffworks.com/5-failed-mcdonalds-menu-items1.htm#page=5|publisher=HowStuffWorks, Inc|accessdate=March 11, 2014}}</ref>
===Poland=== Offerings in Polish McDonald's restaurants include: the WieśMac ("Country Mac"), a quarter-pound beef patty with onions, lettuce, cheese, mustard, and [[horseradish sauce]] on a sesame seed bun;<ref>{{cite web |author=David K. Israel |url=http://www.mentalfloss.com/blogs/archives/94251 |title=McDonald’s Menu Items From Around The World |publisher=Mental Floss |date=2011-07-20 |accessdate=2012-08-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120826112323/http://www.mentalfloss.com/blogs/archives/94251 |archivedate=2012-08-26 |df= }}</ref> the Pikantny Kurczakburger ("Spicy Chickenburger"), a chicken sandwich with lettuce and hot [[Mexican cuisine|Mexican]]-style sauce; McWrap – tortilla with chicken available in two versions: Classic (mayonnaise, mild-Mexican sauce, lettuce, rucola, shredded cheese, two slices of tomato and chicken patty) and Honey-Mustard (honey-mustard sauce, lettuce, shredded cheese, two slices of tomato, two strips of bacon and chicken patty). During winter period you can get Kanapka Drwala ("The Lumberjack's Sandwich") – a big bun with pork rinds instead of sesame, a quarter pounder, bacon, big piece of deep-fried cheese, sauce and vegetables. There is a free apple in every Happy Meal.
===Portugal=== Portuguese McDonald's offers a variety of soups, including their national dish of kale soup ([[caldo verde]]) and cream of carrot, white bean and spinach.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonalds.pt/ementa/categorias/sopas/|title=Sopas|work=mcdonalds.pt}}</ref> These are offered as add-ons to Happy meals as well. There is also a McBifana and a McPrego on a ciabatta roll. The Portugal-specific mixed salad contains olives, corn, onions and tomatoes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonalds.pt/ementa/categorias/saladas/|title=Saladas|work=mcdonalds.pt}}</ref> In November 2016 McDonald's Portugal introduced a vegetarian burger option called McVeggie (made from [[quinoa]], bell peppers, wheat flour, wheat protein, vegetable oil, wheat bran, eggs, vegetable starch, spices, salt, onion, garlic, green peas, sugar and mixed herbs).<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.mcdonalds.pt/campanhas/mcveggie/|title=McVeggie|work=mcdonalds.pt}}</ref> For dessert there are Portugal-specific fresh pineapple chunks, apple cinnamon sundae and a sandwich-shaped apple pie. In 2018 McDonald's released a limited-time edition of the Big Mac Bacon, essentially a Big Mac with added bacon.<ref>{{cite web |author=McDonald's |url=https://www.mcdonalds.pt/ementa/categorias/menus/ |title=McMenu |publisher=McDonald's |date=2018-08-20 |accessdate=2018-09-17}}</ref> Beer is available in all restaurants.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonalds.pt/ementa/categorias/sobremesas/|title=Sobremesas|work=mcdonalds.pt}}</ref> In October of the same year, Chicken Country has been introduced as a cheap option (EuroPoupança) to purchase, considered as a side with any menu, like many other products.
===Russia=== In Russia, McDonald's started selling special burgers with ingredients 100% made in the Russian Federation such as cheese, bread, tomatoes, beef, bacon, lettuce in 2015 under the "Биф А-ля Рус (Beef à la Russe)" name, aimed at authentic Russian native hamburger.<ref>{{ru icon}} [http://mcdonalds.ru/new-products /Макдональдс Новинки Меню]. Retrieved 14 February 2015.</ref>
===Serbia=== In Serbia, McDonald's offers the McBaguette sandwich. The sandwich is available in two varieties including chicken or ham & cheese. The restaurants throughout the country offer [[Alcoholic beverage|alcoholic]] and [[energy drinks]]. They also offer orange juice and apple juice for the junior menus.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://mcdonalds.rs/cenovnik/|title=Cenovnik|work=McDonald's|accessdate=8 October 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160109080450/http://mcdonalds.rs/cenovnik/|archive-date=9 January 2016|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
===Slovakia=== In Slovakia, McDonald's offers the McSyr, a sandwich containing breaded fried cheese and tartar sauce which emulates the Slovak dish [[vyprážaný syr]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonalds.sk/sk/novinky/fajnovky.shtml|title=Novinky|work=mcdonalds.sk|accessdate=8 October 2015|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://archive.is/20130922161520/http://www.mcdonalds.sk/sk/novinky/fajnovky.shtml|archivedate=22 September 2013|df=}}</ref> It is similar to the Czech McSmažák. Also, like in the United Kingdom, McDonald's restaurants in Slovakia serve donuts, which are named McDonuts. McDonuts can be served with either vanilla or chocolate frosting.
===Slovenia=== The McCountry sandwich served in Croatia is also available in the [[Slovenia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonalds.si/ponudba/glavne-jedi/mccountry/ |title=Mcdonalds |publisher=Mcdonalds |date= |accessdate=2015-09-02}}</ref>
===Sweden=== [[Sweden|Swedish]] McDonald's occasionally, when there is a time-limited campaign, serve the El Maco and offer gluten free buns without an extra cost. Since 2018 McDonald's in Sweden also serve an all vegan burger called the McVegan. This burger is served with a vegan patty made out of soy, salad, tomatoes, cucumber, onions and vegan McFeast Sauce.<ref>{{cite web |author= |url=http://slymarketing.com/i-thought-i-hated-mcdonalds/ |title=I Thought I Hated McDonalds |publisher=Slymarketing.com |date=2010-08-14 |accessdate=2012-08-14 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120318191652/http://slymarketing.com/i-thought-i-hated-mcdonalds |archive-date=2012-03-18 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref>
=== Switzerland === Swiss McDonald's serve "The Prime" Burger, a beef burger with bacon, Gruyère cheese and special sauces created by Swiss Chef René Schudel. With a current price of CHF 10.90 (approx. USD 12.00) for the burger only it is one of the most expensive McDonald's burgers worldwide.
===Ukraine=== Ukraine features the [[McLavash]] sandwich on its menus in the southern part of the country, which is served in flatbread. It has two spicy beef patties, some greens, onion and tomato. The McLavash is also served in some other nearby countries.
===United Kingdom and Ireland=== British and Irish McDonald's serve the Chicken Legend, a chicken breast coated in seasoned batter either spicy tomato salsa, BBQ Sauce or mayonnaise.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonalds.co.uk/content/ukhome/product_nutrition.chicken.243.chicken-legend-with-bacon-cool-mayo.html |title=Product Nutrition |publisher=McDonalds.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> In June 2011, [[Deli Choices]], a line of sandwich rolls with fillings, was released in the UK. [[Curry]] flavoured sauce is available for McNuggets in British and Irish restaurants. From 2003 to 2005, menus included the [[Quorn (food product)|Quorn]] Premiere, a vegetarian burger with sweet chilli sauce, light [[Hellmann's and Best Foods|Hellmann's]] mayonnaise, tomato, and lettuce in a [[focaccia]] bun. In 2015, McDonald's released a limited edition burger in the Republic of Ireland called the McMór. In 2016, this burger was brought back for six weeks. It features Ballymaloe Relish, Charleville cheddar and a potato bun.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mcdonalds.ie/iehome/food/full_menu/beef/mc-mor.html |title=McMór burger |publisher=McDonalds.ie |date= |accessdate=2016-04-20}}</ref> In 2016, McDonald's launched the brand new BBQ Smokehouse Range of burgers. The two burgers that were launched contained chicken and beef with bacon, cheese and BBQ Sauce.
Past promotional items have included the Apple Pie Sundae, [[Mozzarella sticks|Mozzarella Dippers]], Cheese Melt Dippers, the Summer Chorizo Supreme, BBQ Chicken Premiere with Bacon, the 1955 burger, Apple and Blackberry Pie, and Festive Pie, with [[mincemeat]] and [[custard]]. A series of burgers intending to represent various American locales has been released under the "Great Taste of America" name. These burgers have represented New York City, Chicago, [[Las Vegas Valley|Las Vegas]], [[Texas]], [[Arizona]], Miami, California, and [[New Orleans]]. Not all of these burgers resemble their respective local cuisines.<ref>{{cite news |title=McDonald's Introduces the UK to Incorrect Tastes of America |last=Wheeler |first=Robin |url=http://blogs.riverfronttimes.com/gutcheck/2011/06/mcdonalds_introduces_the_uk_to.php |newspaper=[[The Riverfront Times]] |date=6 June 2011 |accessdate=5 May 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120527012859/http://blogs.riverfronttimes.com/gutcheck/2011/06/mcdonalds_introduces_the_uk_to.php |archive-date=2012-05-27 |dead-url=yes |df= }}</ref> British and Irish McDonald's also released a series of burgers representing several different countries in the world. These have included Australia, South Africa, Canada and Mexico. Several Summer and Winter menus have been launched. Also, McDonald's has launched several kinds of McFlurrys over the past few years, such as [[Cornetto (ice cream)|Cornetto]], [[Cadbury]] brands like Dairy Milk which is available all year and the creme egg which is only available around Easter.
McDonald’s UK also offers a range of premium burgers known as the Signature Collection, consisting of three burgers, The Classic, The Spicy and The BBQ. Each comes with a thicker patty made from higher quality beef which takes longer to cook and is served on a brioche bun.
==North America== ===Canada=== {{Main|McDonald's Canada}} French fries may be substituted with McDonald's version of [[poutine]]. Previously, McDonald's poutine was available widely only in Francophone Canada (Quebec and parts of New Brunswick) and available elsewhere on a more limited basis; however, in December 2013, McDonald's formally announced the nationwide availability of poutine at all of its Canadian restaurants, due to popular demand.<ref>[http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/mcdonald-s-poutine-hitting-menus-across-canada-1.2454323 "McDonald's poutine hitting menus across Canada"], CBC News, 06 December 2013.</ref> Quebec also saw the release of the limited-time 1967 Burger, commemorating Canada's first McDonald's franchise. Deli Choices were introduced throughout Canada in 2006. Unique to Canadian McDonald's locations is the McMini, miniature sandwiches with grilled or crispy chicken; flavors include [[Pesto]] Chicken (later replaced by Zesty [[Mango]]) and Spicy Thai.<ref>{{cite web|author=SirJman |url=http://www.travellingmcds.com/2011/11/mcmini-thai-chilli-chicken-and-pesto.html |title=McDonald's Around the World: Chicken McMini Thai Chilli and Pesto – Lasalle, Canada – May 2010 |publisher=Travellingmcds.com |date=2011-11-05 |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> As in the United States, the McRib periodically appears on the menu for limited runs. The crispy chicken patty used in the McChicken sandwich sold in Canada uses both white and dark meat – it is essentially the same size and taste as the original McChicken that first appeared in the USA in 1980.
Seasonal items previously available in McDonald's in Canada include the McLobster, a [[lobster roll]], available in the [[Maritime Provinces]], called ''McHomard'' in French.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/ct-biz-mcdonalds-mchomard-canada,0,4348743.photo | work=Chicago Tribune | title=McHomard – Canada}}</ref> Regionally a blueberry-shortbread McFlurry is also available. Discontinued items in Canadian McDonald's include pizzas, including a [[calzone]]-style "McPizza." The McFlurry Originated in New Brunswick.
===Mexico=== Mexican McDonald's locations do not serve fish, except during the period of Lent. Special items at these locations have included the Flaming Hot [[Doritos]] Quarter Pounder and the BBQ Double Burger. For breakfast, Mexican McDonald's locations serve the McMollete, which is made on an English muffin spread with beans, topped with a slice of melted cheese and pico de gallo.<ref name=johnson>{{cite web|url=http://www.businessinsider.com/mcdonalds-caters-to-local-palettes-2011-1?op=1|accessdate=3 August 2012|title=Check out the awesome meals you can buy at McDonald's around the world|author=Johnson, Robert|date=22 January 2011|work=Business Insider}}</ref> Mexican locations also serve a version of the McSkillet burrito known as the "McBurrito".
===United States=== McDonald's restaurants in the United States of America offer various types of [[shellfish]] dishes on a regional basis, such as seasonal [[lobster]] rolls in [[New England]] and [[crab cakes]] in the [[Mid-Atlantic states]]. Parts of the [[Upper Midwest]] sell [[Johnsonville Foods|Johnsonville Brats]], a toasted hot dog bun with a Johnsonville [[bratwurst]] topped with spicy mustard and onions. Other regional variations include the [[Texas]] Homestyle Burger, and traditional [[Cuisine of the Southern United States|Southern]] breakfast items, such as a [[country ham]] biscuit and [[biscuits and gravy]]. Locations in the Southwest regularly offer burgers topped with [[New Mexico chile]].
Hawaii locations offer [[saimin]] on their regular menu,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://tastyislandhawaii.com/2010/06/26/mcdonalds-saimin/ |title=McDonald’s Saimin | The Tasty Island |publisher=Tastyislandhawaii.com |date=2010-06-26 |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> and include [[Spam (food)|Spam]], [[linguiça|Portuguese sausage]] and [[rice]] as a breakfast option. Pineapple and taro pies, as regularly sold in some Asian countries, have been occasionally offered on the regular menu, along with [[haupia]] pies; pineapple is also sometimes available as a topping on burgers. In [[Waikiki]] locations, small trays of pineapple can be ordered as a side dish. Except for saimin, Hawaiian and selected Asian specialty items can also be found in McDonald's in the US territories of [[Guam]] and the [[Commonwealth of the Northern Mariana Islands|Northern Mariana Islands]]. During Easter time, Hawaii, Guam and the CNMI all feature the Double Filet-O-Fish meal due to having a heavy concentration of Catholics (mostly people who immigrated from the Philippines) in that region.
====Puerto Rico==== As in Mexico, Puerto Rican McDonald's do not serve fish and serve the McCriollo (with eggs and cheese) for breakfast. Criollo is a Puerto Rican bread, like a baguette, but bigger and softer. Basically, the McCriollo is a sandwich with ham, cheese, and egg on a Criollo roll.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.sandwichreviews.com/2010/06/mccriollo-puerto-rican-egg-mcmuffin.html |title=It's What's Between: McCriollo: The Puerto Rican Egg McMuffin |publisher=Sandwichreviews.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref>
==Oceania== ===Australia=== The most popular Australian McDonald's menu items are the McOz Burger and the Create Your Taste kiosk. You use a touch screen to choose types of bread, beef patties, chicken patties, bacon, cheese, pickles, onions, lettuce, tomato and sauce. Your order is delivered by a waiter when dining in-store. Previous products have included: Shaker Fries, similar to Japan's Shaka Shaka Chicken; a [[BLT]]; the Mc[[Beefsteak]], promoted by [[country music]] singer [[Lee Kernaghan]];<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PL3WCXJOpv4 |title=McDonalds Commercial – McBeefsteak |publisher=YouTube |date= |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> the Big [[Kahuna]] Burger, served with pineapple; the Romano Burger, a chicken patty with Italian sauce and mozzarella served on an herbed focaccia bun; the [[Tandoor]]i Burger, a chicken patty with lettuce and mint yogurt sauce served on flatbread; and a [[Chive]] [[Omelette]] Roll.
Current products have included: Chicken Mcbites, Classic Angus and Aussie BBQ Angus.
Every so often (typically once a year) the McOz is sold for a limited time. The McOz is a quarter-pound burger with lettuce, tomato, cheese, mustard, ketchup and the so-called Australian ingredients of [[beetroot]] and cooked onion served on a sesame seed bun.
===New Zealand=== {{Main|McDonald's New Zealand}} [[File:McDonald's Kiwiburger.jpg|thumb|200px|Kiwiburger]] Many McDonald's menu items in New Zealand are similar to those in Australia. Some unique items include the [[Kiwiburger]], a beef patty with McMuffin egg, tomato, lettuce, cheese, onion, beetroot, ketchup, and mustard.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bestadsontv.com/ad/38826/McDonalds-Kiwiburger |title=TV ad: McDonald's: Kiwiburger |publisher=Bestadsontv.com |date=2011-08-19 |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> In 2011, a special "Kiwi Menu" was featured to promote the country's hosting of the [[2011 Rugby World Cup]].
In April 2012, McDonald's re-released the El Maco, a variant of the product of the same name offered in other markets, such as Scandinavia. El Maco had previously been sold in New Zealand in the early 1990s.<ref>{{cite web|title=McDonald's NZ (maccasnz) on Twitter|url=https://twitter.com/MaccasNZ/status/189864932047720448|publisher=McDonald's New Zealand, Twitter|accessdate=11 April 2012}}</ref>
In 1996, the New Zealand affiliate bought out failing local fast food chain [[Georgie Pie]], which based itself around [[meat pie (Australia and New Zealand)|Australian and New Zealand meat pies]]. McDonald's trialed a partial relaunch of the Georgie Pie brand in May 2013 with one pie flavor sold through eleven of its restaurants. In October 2013, the affiliate announced it would expand the sale of Georgie Pie to 107 of its 161 restaurants by the end of 2013.<ref name="NZHreturn">{{cite news|last=Adams|first=Christopher|title=Georgie Pie now to be sold across NZ|url=http://www.nzherald.co.nz/business/news/article.cfm?c_id=3&objectid=11132811|accessdate=1 October 2013|newspaper=[[New Zealand Herald]]|date=1 October 2013}}</ref> As of January 2017, two pie flavors are available: Steak Mince 'n' Cheese and Bacon 'n' Egg.
==South America== ===Argentina=== McNífica is served. McDonald's Argentina serves Big Tasty Angus Burger, made with premium Argentinean Angus Beef. Argentina is the only country besides Israel in which McDonald's has full kosher locations.<ref name="frommers.com"/> These are the only places in the world where McDonald's burgers are barbecued on charcoal rather than fried.<ref name=oddee>{{cite web|url=http://www.oddee.com/item_96970.aspx |title=10 of the Strangest Mc Donald's Meals – Oddee.com (mcdonalds meals) |publisher=Oddee.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> Croissants are served for breakfast and afternoon tea.
===Brazil=== In [[Brazil]], McDonald's offers the Cheddar McMelt, a beef burger with creamy cheddar cheese and grilled onions, flavored with soy sauce on a whole-wheat bun.
Banana-flavored pies are served in Brazilian McDonald's.<ref>{{cite web|last=Nasr |first=Susan L. |url=http://money.howstuffworks.com/10-items-from-mcdonalds-international-menu9.htm |title=HowStuffWorks "10 Unusual Items from McDonald's International Menu" |publisher=Money.howstuffworks.com |date=2009-04-13 |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref>
A vegetarian burger started being available, on a trial basis, on 8 November 2018.<ref>{{cite news |title=Mcdonald's vegetariano: McDonald’s lança inédito veggie burger no Brasil {{!}} EXAME |url=https://exame.abril.com.br/marketing/mcdonalds-lanca-veggie-burger-no-brasil/ |accessdate=31 October 2018 |work=exame.abril.com.br |language=pt-BR}}</ref> This followed a trial of a vegan burger in October/November 2017.<ref>{{cite news |title=McDonald’s lança o seu primeiro hambúrguer vegetariano {{!}} EXAME |url=https://exame.abril.com.br/marketing/mcdonalds-primeiro-hamburguer-vegetariano/ |date=9 October 2017 |work=exame.abril.com.br |language=pt-BR}}</ref>
===Chile=== In Chile, cheese [[empanada]]s are sold at all McDonald's locations in Chile as side dishes. Also, customers can add [[avocado]] paste to any sandwich, other than the McPalta ([[Chilean Spanish]] for ''McAvocado''),<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.unitednationsoffood.com/2010/07/chilean-food-nyc/ |title=Chilean Food NYC | United Nations of Food (NYC) |publisher=United Nations of Food |date= |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref> whose basis is avocado paste along burger as current '''Cuarto Palta''' (''Avocado Quarter Pounder'')<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4c64uVJl05s |title=McDonald's Chile – Cuarto Palta |publisher=YouTube |date=2013-08-16 |accessdate=2013-10-12}}</ref> and '''McWrap Palta with [[Fuze Beverage|Fuze Tea]]''', sliced fried chicken with lettuce, tomatoes and purple onion in a tortilla.
Celebrating the 200-year anniversary of the founding of Chilean republic, in 2010 McDonald's offered '''Combo Bicentenario''',<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.chile.com/secciones/ver_seccion.php?id=122810 |title=McDonald's pone pebre a Combo Bicentenario |publisher=Chile.com |date=2010-09-04 |accessdate=2013-10-12 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131015084111/http://www.chile.com/secciones/ver_seccion.php?id=122810 |archivedate=2013-10-15 |df= }}</ref> a beef burger with [[pebre]], a Chilean condiment made of coriander, chopped onion, olive oil, garlic and ground spicy chili pepper, and [[merkén]], a smoked chili pepper. Recently, celebrating Chile's 2013 National Day on September, the fast food restaurant served [[empanadas]] de pino<ref>{{cite web|url=https://foursquare.com/stark/checkin/5227c19211d2e9590a1ee0cc?s=dSrQkEnkwdhXSqb8LGpJDTiZcdY&ref=tw |title=desde mañana, vas a poder pedir empanadas de pino en @mcdonalds_cl! |publisher= |date=2013-09-04 |accessdate=2013-10-12}}</ref> (stuffed with beef, olives, onions, raisins, and boiled eggs) as special side dishes.
For breakfast, McDonald's serves [[croissant]]s, also known in Chile as '''Medialuna''' and local versions of two Chilean sandwiches: '''Barros Jarpa''', whose basis is ham and molten cheese on bread, and '''Lomo Palta''',<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mcdonalds.cl/sub-secciones/nutricion/include/img/imgpdf/desayuno.jpg |title=Tabla nutricional de productos McDonald's |publisher=McDonalds.cl |date=2013-05-24 |accessdate=2013-10-12 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131014114559/http://www.mcdonalds.cl/sub-secciones/nutricion/include/img/imgpdf/desayuno.jpg |archivedate=2013-10-14 |df= }}</ref> a avocado paste along a slice pork.
===Colombia=== Colombian McDonald's restaurants serve the McCriollo breakfast combo, which includes a sausage patty, two traditional Colombian [[arepa]]s, scrambled eggs and sweetcorn, a hashbrown, coffee, butter, and [[Fruit preserves|jam]].<ref>{{cite web|author=SirJman |url=http://travellingmcds.blogspot.com/2011/11/mccriollo-breakfast-bogota-colombia.html |title=McDonald's Around the World: McCriollo Breakfast – Bogota Colombia – March 2011 |publisher=Travellingmcds.blogspot.com |date=2011-11-29 |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref>
===Ecuador=== In [[Ecuador]], McDonald's started selling cheese empanadas, burgers with cheese sausage or guacamole, blackberry sundae and nuggets with spicy sausage in 2012 under the "Nuestros sabores" campaign, aimed at providing a more local cuisine.<ref>{{es icon}} [http://www.elemprendedor.ec/mcdonalds-empanadas-de-queso/ La cadena de comida rápida pretende ampliar su oferta insertando un menú de “gastronomía ecuatoriana”]. Retrieved 1 July 2013.</ref>
===Peru=== In Peru, McDonald's offers [[Ají dulce|ají]], a spicy sauce made from peppers, as a condiment.<ref name=really>{{cite web |url=http://www.ireallylikefood.com/728110091/mcdonald%E2%80%99s-around-the-world--menu-items-you-may-not-know-so-well/ |title=McDonald’s Around the World: Menu Items You May Not Know So Well |publisher=ireallylikefood |date=2010-06-02 |accessdate=2012-08-14 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120701083418/http://www.ireallylikefood.com/728110091/mcdonald%E2%80%99s-around-the-world--menu-items-you-may-not-know-so-well/ |archivedate=2012-07-01 |df= }}</ref> Peruvian locations also serve Pollo Crujiente ("crunchy chicken") and [[Inca Kola]]. Now, McDonald´s offers "Peruvian Foods" and blackberry Sundae.
===Venezuela=== In Venezuela, McDonald's offers arepas, [[empanadas]] for breakfast; these are traditional breakfast foods. Venezuelan locations have also served fried [[Cassava|yuca]] sticks.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m3190/is_15_39/ai_n13649042/pg_3/ |title=Studying McDonald's abroad: overseas branches merge regional preferences, corporate directives |publisher=Findarticles.com |date= |accessdate=2012-08-14}}</ref>

{{BLP sources|date=November 2016}}
'''John Peter Cole''' (b. 1928, [[Sydney]], [[Australia]]) is a [[United Kingdom|British]] [[geographer]].
He graduated from the [[University of Nottingham]] in 1950. He later returned there to join the staff of the Geography Department, rising to become Professor of [[Urban geography|Urban]] and [[regional geography|Regional Geography]]. He is currently [[Emeritus Professor]] of Geography at the university.
Since 1957 he has written or co-authored over 25 books on geography.
==Bibliography== *''Geography of World Affairs'' (1959, several later editions) *''Quantitative Geography: Techniques and Theories in Geography'' (with [[C. A. M. King]]) (1968) *''New Ways in Geography: A Guide for Teachers'' (with N. J. Beynon) (1969) *''Latin America: An Economic and Social Geography'' (1975) *''Situations in Human Geography: A Practical Approach'' (1978) *''Regional Inequality in Services and Purchasing Power in the USSR, 1940-1976'' (with M. E. Harrison) (1978) *''Peru, 1940-2000: Performance and Prospects'' (with P. M. Mather) (1978) *''The Development Gap: A Spatial Analysis of World Poverty and Inequality'' (1981) *''Geography of the Soviet Union'' (1984) *''China 1950-2000: Performance and Prospects'' (1985) *''Development and Underdevelopment: A Profile of the Third World'' (1987) *''Modern Soviet Economic Performance'' (with Trevor Buck) (1987) *''Geography of the World's Major Regions'' (1996) *''A Geography of the European Union'' (with Francis Cole) (1997)

{{more footnotes|date=May 2018}} '''John Oliver Wheeler''' (19 December 1924 – 24 May 2015)<ref>{{cite news|title= Obituary: John Oliver WHEELER |date= 30 May 2015 |newspaper= The Vancouver Sun |url= http://www.legacy.com/obituaries/vancouversun/obituary.aspx?pid=174972148 |accessdate= 15 December 2015 }}</ref> was a [[Canadians|Canadian]] [[Geology|geologist]], who spent most of his career as a research scientist with the [[Geological Survey of Canada]].
==Family== Wheeler came from a family of [[surveyor]]s. His father, Sir [[Edward Oliver Wheeler]], participated in the first [[Topography|topographical]] survey of [[Mount Everest]] in 1921, and later rose to become [[Surveyor General of India]]. Wheeler's grandfather, [[Arthur Oliver Wheeler]], mapped British Columbia’s [[Selkirk Mountains]] and the [[British Columbia]]-[[Alberta]] border.
==Career== In 1952, Wheeler joined the Geological Survey of Canada. He worked for them for 39 years. He spent the first 20 years mapping the geology of 100,000 square kilometres. The greatest part of this achievement was the [[American cordillera|Cordillera]] from northern [[Washington (U.S. state)|Washington]] to eastern [[Alaska]]. He also mapped several regions of the [[Yukon]], including the [[Saint Elias Mountains]], and parts of British Columbia, including the Selkirk Mountains. His work has become the foundation of all subsequent Cordilleran mapping studies and set the standard for geological mapping in Canada. In 1968, Wheeler was appointed head of the Survey’s Cordilleran Section.
In the 1970s, Wheeler moved to [[Ottawa]] to become a manager. He was promoted to Chief Geologist, with responsibility for the scientific program. In the 1980s he returned to Vancouver to be the General Editor of the new 8-volume edition of the ''Geology of Canada''. He prepared many of the large regional and national maps.
In the early 1980s, he lobbied for establishment of the [[Lithoprobe]] project. This 20-year project performed geoscientific studies on and mapped deep [[Seismology|seismic]] [[transect]]s of Canada’s [[Crust (geology)|crust]]. He served as chairman of Lithoprobe’s steering committee for two years.
Wheeler retired in 1990. During his later years he remainined as an unsalaried emeritus research scientist at the Geological Survey of Canada in Vancouver, and was a lead author of the 2004 Canada-USA collaborative Geological Map of North America.
== Geological Association of Canada == Wheeler became a member of the [[Geological Association of Canada]] in 1957. He was a Councillor from 1968-1972. He served as President from 1970-1971.
==Accolades== *Elected Fellow of the [[Royal Society of Canada]] (1969) *[[Logan Medal]] of the [[Geological Association of Canada]] (1983) *Honorary Doctorate of Science (''honoris causa'') of the [[University of British Columbia]] (2000) *[[Massey Medal]] of the [[Royal Canadian Geographical Society]] (2002)
==References== ===Citations=== {{reflist}}
